# Problem

Show that any solution of @eq-1.37 can be written in the form @eq-1.38.

$$
v_{\xi\eta} = 0
$$ {#eq-1.37}

$$
v\left(\xi, \eta\right) = f\left(\xi\right) + g\left(\eta\right)
$$ {#eq-1.38}

# Solution

$$
\int v_{\xi\eta} d\xi = v_{\eta} = h(\eta)
$$

$$
\int v_{\eta} d\xi = \int h(\eta) d\xi = v(\xi, \eta) = f(\xi) + g(\eta)
$$

$$
v(\xi, \eta) = f(\xi) + g(\eta)
$$
